repnme.cdata!:
Zimbabwe - Emergency Drought Recovery and
            Mitigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Emergency Drought Recovery and
            Mitigation Project in Zambia. The two principal objectives
            of the program were: (a) to address the risk of widespread
            famine in Zimbabwe; and (b) to provide the conditions under
            which the productive sectors could rebound quickly from the
            drought.  Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) approval to procure
            inputs must be given in time whilst sourcing for funds is
            still in progress; (ii) there is need for government to
            provide enough funds for the whole project especially if the
            component involves different ministries; (iii) the project
            revealed the capacity constraint of government agencies in
            implementing emergency drought relief operations
            effectively; (iv) government should encourage and provide
            incentives for input suppliers to invest in input
            distribution warehouses in small holder farm areas; (v)
            planning should not be centralised and whenever possible
            involve all levels and layers of beneficiaries to enable
            transparency and acceptability; (vi) emergency procurement
            procedures need to be more carefully designed and fully
            articulated at appraisal stage; (vii) the government Tender
            Board should be requested to process emergency tenders on
            their own instead of mixing them with other tenders; and
            (viii) during the identification and appraisal stage,
            Government should play a more significant role inorder to
            influence project design.

repnme.cdata!:
Zimbabwe - Emergency Drought Recovery and
            Mitigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Emergency
            Drought Recovery and Mitigation Project is to provide the
            Government with timely financial resources in support of its
            drought relief and recovery program.  This program will
            alleviate human suffering, both at present and in the
            future, by restoring and enhancing Zimbabwe's
            productive capacity.  It will do so by providing
            agricultural inputs that are essential for the next planting
            season, rehabilitating the water supply system, providing
            for critical inputs for the transport of goods needed for
            relief and recovery, and upgrading the public works programs
            through which drought relief is distributed.  The program is
            designed to give special consideration to the recovery needs
            of agricultural smallholders.  The project will also help
            narrow the balance of payments gap that will result from
            incremental imports and the collapse of food exports.  This
            will lessen the risk that this natural disaster might derail
            the Government's broad based economic structural
            adjustment program.  Finally, the project will assure the
            strengthening of short and long-term institutional capacity
            in agriculture, water, and public works, to reduce the
            country's vulnerability to future external risks and to
            increase food security.

display_title.display_title:
Zimbabwe - Emergency Drought
            Recovery and Mitigation Project : Main report
